problemStatement.plain: The Riemann Hypothesis implies various consequences for prime distribution, including bounds on the Mertens function M(x), Chebyshev functions theta(x) and psi(x), and prime gaps.

open: Prime Number Theorem not in Mathlib (but in PrimeNumberTheoremAnd)
knownResults.goal: Formalize definitions and state consequences as axioms

currentState.focus: Extended with von Mangoldt, Chebyshev psi, zeta values from Mathlib

knowledge.progressSummary: Successfully formalized Mertens function, Chebyshev theta and psi functions. Found that RH is already in Mathlib! Computed values for M(n), verified Moebius function properties, stated RH consequences as axioms.

builtItems.name: mertens
builtItems.description: M(n) = sum of Moebius function up to n

builtItems.name: chebyshevTheta
builtItems.description: theta(n) = sum of log(p) over primes p <= n

builtItems.name: chebyshevPsi
builtItems.description: psi(n) = sum of von Mangoldt function up to n

builtItems.name: rh_zeros_on_critical_line
builtItems.description: RH implies non-trivial zeros have Re = 1/2

builtItems.name: rh_implies_psi_bound
builtItems.description: RH implies psi(x) = x + O(sqrt(x) log^2 x)
